intro: Spergularia semidecandra, commonly known as the coastal sand spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to arid and coastal environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in dunes or along shorelines. Spergularia semidecandra is a hardy species capable of surviving in harsh, salt-laden conditions.
